content: Just completed a new draft of a GitHub permissions policy here https://github.com/rust-lang/wg-governance/issues/4. Feedback is most welcome!

@Nell Shamrell-Harrington It might be good to keep it in our draft RFCs folder, so that we can keep it in version control. :slight_smile: https://github.com/rust-lang/wg-governance/tree/master/draft-rfcs
You should have write permissions.
an excellent idea!
I think I will do that after this round of feedback - expand the outline I have now into a fully drafted RFC
RFC has been formally submitted! https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2872

I'm still working on landing this RFC, I've brought this comment https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2872#discussion_r400206110 to the attention of the Mozilla Security team - as they were the ones who originally recommended GitHub org admins have separate GitHub accounts.
I'm not personally opposed to taking that section out of the RFC, though, depending on what Mozilla security says
Ugh, what a pain.
It seems clear that this is not what the kind of behavior those ToS are trying to prevent
but .. they say what they say
Would this be something worth taking up with GitHub?
I wonder if they can "grant" us a few "paid" accounts for free?
Well, before that . . . it's a question of dialogue about the why . . .
I think once Mozilla Security team explains their rationale, it would indeed be a good idea to discuss w/ GitHub.

Well I believe the motivation is a separate account ensures that you cannot cause catastrophic damage. This could be through a security breach on your end (stolen devices or information) or on a service providers end (such as admin capable API tokens being leaked). I do have a slight preference for separate accounts not from a security standpoint but an organization perspective. I've found that permissions are better when admins have to use the same permission structure as regular users for most of their work, because it makes any flaws or annoyances apparent to the people who can change it.
And these are all good reasons to bring up the topic with GitHub. This isn't a Rust-specific problem. So, what would the next steps be?
If they haven't already done so, someone from Mozilla security is going to respond on the RFC
@Pietro Albini and I have a standing meeting every other week with GitHub for Infra issues - so we could bring this up then
@Nell Shamrell-Harrington want to add it to our agenda and bring it up yourself during the call?
can do!
I am 99.99% certain that GitHub is going to say us having multiple accounts is fine for admins is fine. Looks like Mozilla security has also responded explaining why they feel this is necessary.
Got an answer from GitHub https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2872#discussion_r409760310
Was your conversation in writing somehow? It would be nice to have a paper trail just so we have something to point to in case anyone (from within GitHub or not) raises this as an issue.
It was not , unfortunately, and I don't know that we will be able to get that.
Okay.
I think this is finally ready to move forward https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2872
